name: Germany (Deutsch)
pronouns: “_” or “ * ” , example: er_sie, ersie, er:sie, er*sie from “er” (he) and “sie” (she)

name: France (French)
pronouns: “ile” : a mix of the French words "il" (he) and "elle" (she)

name: Madagascar
pronouns: “ile” : a mix of the French words "il" (he) and "elle" (she)

name: Mali
pronouns: “ile” : a mix of the French words 'il' (he) and 'elle'(she)"

name: Belgium (Dutch)
pronouns: ze, hun, ze / zij, hen, hun -  they, them, theirs

name: Israel (Hebrew)
pronouns: “ol” or “imot” - “im” is masculine and “ot” is feminine

name: Denmark (Danish)
pronouns: de, dem, deres / hen, hen, hens - they, them, theirs

name: Estonia (Estonian)
pronouns: “tema, teda, tema” (formal) or “ta, teda, tema” - they/them/theirs

name: Saint Helena, Ascension, and Tristan da Cunha
